content:
I was very puzzled a minute ago when I tried to star a message by hitting *, like I learned to do long ago and have many times, and nothing happened.

I spent a bit of time trying again, wondering what was wrong (was the shortcut removed? is the message unsent? ... no, it has the timestamp showing), debugging further by finding the "star" widget with the mouse and confirming I could do it that way.
Then I went to the keyboard shortcuts help to try to figure out more, and learned that the shortcut is Ctrl+s now.

I don't have a strong preference between * and Ctrl+s; * never felt super ergonomic to me, though it was memorable.

But the debugging session wasn't a great user experience. I think even something like the one-time notice we did for C -> x, imperfect though that was, would have helped a lot.
Yea, seems like we skipped the deprecation notice for this one.
Yeah, we should add one. @Joshua Pan you in the mood for doing it? If not I imagine @Anupam Dagar can do it soon.
I'll see if I have time tomorrow, @Anupam Dagar feel free to pick it up if you don't see me post here that I'm working on it.
@Joshua Pan I'll start working on it today. :smiley:
Just opened #9640 adding the deprecation notice for '*' hotkey.
